sen.j: 上村 松篁（うえむら しょうこう、1902年11月4日 - 2001年3月11日）は日本画家。
sen.e: Shoko UEMURA (b. November 4, 1902 – d. March 11, 2001) was a Nihonga (Japanese-style painting) artist.
Shoko UEMURA (November 4, 1902 – March 11, 2001) was a Nihonga (Japanese-style painting) artist.
sen.cmt: 生年・没年の表記が独自ルールになっていますので一般ルールに訂正しました。
sen.e: Shoko UEMURA (November 4, 1902 – March 11, 2001) was a Nihonga (Japanese-style painting) artist.

sen.j: 京都府京都市中京区生まれ。
sen.e: Born in Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
He was born in Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: ピリオドがありますが訳文は文章ではなく分節です。修正しました。
sen.e: He was born in Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 本名、信太郎。
sen.e: His real name was Shintaro.
His real name was Shintaro.
His real name was Shintaro.

sen.j: 1921年（大正10年）、京都市立絵画専門学校（現：京都市立芸術大学）に入学すると同時に西山翠嶂に師事。
sen.e: He entered the Kyoto City Specialist School of Painting (currently Kyoto City Art University) in 1921, and at the same time became Suisho NISHIYAMA's pupil.
He entered the Kyoto City Specialist School of Painting (currently Kyoto City University of Arts) in 1921, and also became the disciple of Suisho NISHIYAMA at the same.
sen.cmt: 大学名称を訂正しました。アポストロフィを用いたフレーズを避け、文章表記として一般的な形に修正しました。
sen.e: He entered the Kyoto City Specialist School of Painting (currently Kyoto City University of Arts) in 1921, and also became the disciple of Suisho NISHIYAMA at the same.

sen.j: 画塾の青甲社に入塾する。
sen.e: He entered Shoko-sha, a private school of painting.
He entered Shoko-sha, a private school of painting.
He entered Shoko-sha, a private school of painting.

sen.j: その後は帝展・日本美術展覧会で主に作品を発表したが、1948年（昭和23年）に日展を離れ、数名の画家と共に新団体『創造美術』を結成。
sen.e: Later Shoko mainly introduced his works at Teiten (Japan Art Exhibitions) and Nitten (Japan Fine Arts Exhibitions), but in 1948 he left the latter and formed a new organization, "Sozo Bijutsu" (Creation Art), with several other painters.

In later years, Shoko mostly presented his works at Teiten (The Japan Art Academy Exhibitions) and Nitten (The Japan Fine Arts Exhibitions), but in 1948 he left Nitten and formed a new organization with several other artists called "Sozo Bijyutsu" (Creation of Art).
sen.cmt: 「作品を発表した」を「introduced his works」としていますが、より一般的な「presented」としました。帝展の解説が対訳と異なっていましたので合わせて修正しました。原文と異なり日展を「後者」で置き換えていましたので、修正しました。
sen.e: In later years, Shoko mostly presented his works at Teiten (The Japan Art Academy Exhibitions) and Nitten (The Japan Fine Arts Exhibitions), but in 1948 he left Nitten and formed a new organization with several other artists called "Sozo Bijyutsu" (Creation of Art).

sen.j: 徹底した写実に基づいた格調の高い花鳥画を得意とし、多くの名作を残した。
sen.e: Shoko's speciality was paintings of flowers and birds which were extremely lifelike and elegant, and he left many masterpieces.
He left many masterpieces, while the eloquent point of Shoko was the bird-and flower genre of Japanese paintings in dignified style based on a through, realistic depiction of the subjects.
sen.cmt: 「徹底した写実に基づいた」という原文が「extremely lifelike」と意訳されています。似た意味ではあっても原文の意味するものを訳しきっていませんで訂正しました。
sen.e: He left many masterpieces, while the eloquent point of Shoko was the bird-and flower genre of Japanese paintings in dignified style based on a through, realistic depiction of the subjects.

sen.j: 1984年（昭和59年）文化勲章を受章。
sen.e: He was awarded the Order of Culture in 1984.
He was awarded the Order of Culture in 1984.
He was awarded the Order of Culture in 1984.

sen.j: 母は近代美人画の大家、上村松園。
sen.e: His mother was one of the masters of modern bijinga (pictures of beautiful women), Shoen UEMURA.
His mother was one of the masters of bijinga in modern era (pictures of beautiful women), Shoen UEMURA.
sen.cmt: 近代美人画を「modern bijinga」とするのは誤りではありませんが、母親の説明に当たる部分ですので「bijinga in modern era」としました。
sen.e: His mother was one of the masters of bijinga in modern era (pictures of beautiful women), Shoen UEMURA.

sen.j: 息子も同じく日本画家の上村淳之である。
sen.e: His son, Atsushi UEMURA, is also a Nihonga artist.
His son, Atsushi UEMURA, is also a Nihonga artist.
His son, Atsushi UEMURA, is also a Nihonga artist.

sen.j: 略歴
sen.e: Brief Personal History
Brief Personal History
Brief Personal History

sen.j: 1902年：京都に生まれる
sen.e: 1902: Born in Kyoto
1902: He was born in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 下記すべて文章の体裁を取るように修正しました。
sen.e: 1902: He was born in Kyoto.

sen.j: 1921年：『閑庭迎秋』が帝展に初入選する
sen.e: 1921: Awarded his first prize at Teiten for his work "Lazy Garden Welcomes Autumn"
1921: He was awarded his first prize at Teiten for his work "Quiet Garden Welcoming Autumn."
sen.cmt: 「閑庭」は「lazy garden」から「quiet garden」に修正しました。
sen.e: 1921: He was awarded his first prize at Teiten for his work "Quiet Garden Welcoming Autumn."

sen.j: 1928年：『蓮池群鴦図』が帝展の特選となる
sen.e: 1928: Awarded the highest honor at Teiten for his work "Diagram of Lotus Pond with Mandarin Ducks"
1928: He was awarded the highest honor at Teiten for his work "the Scenery of a flock of Mandarin Ducks on a Lotus Pond."
sen.cmt: 「図」を直訳して「diagram」としていますが用法的に誤りです。「Scenery」としました。
sen.e: 1928: He was awarded the highest honor at Teiten for his work "the Scenery of a flock of Mandarin Ducks on a Lotus Pond."

sen.j: 1948年：奥村厚一、秋野不矩、山本丘人らと日本画の団体『創造美術』を結成
sen.e: 1948: Forms organization of Nihonga, "Sozo Bijutsu" with Koichi OKUMURA, Fuku AKINO, Kyujin YAMAMOTO and others
1948: He formed an organization of Nihonga called "Sozo Bijyutsu" with Koichi OKUMURA, Fuku AKINO, Kyujin YAMAMOTO and others.
sen.cmt: なぜかこれだけ現在形に成っていましたので修正しました。organizationに不定冠詞を追加しました。
sen.e: 1948: He formed an organization of Nihonga called "Sozo Bijyutsu" with Koichi OKUMURA, Fuku AKINO, Kyujin YAMAMOTO and others.

sen.j: 1959年：芸術選奨文部大臣賞を受賞
sen.e: 1959: Awarded the Minister of Education Award for Fine Arts
1959: He received the Minister of Education Award for Fine Arts.
sen.cmt: 文章の体裁を取るように修正しました。
sen.e: 1959: He received the Minister of Education Award for Fine Arts.

sen.j: 1967年：日本芸術院賞を受賞
sen.e: 1967: Awarded the Award of the Japan Art Academy
1967: He received the Award of the Japan Art Academy.
sen.cmt: 文章の体裁を取るように修正しました。
sen.e: 1967: He received the Award of the Japan Art Academy.

sen.j: 1973年：勲三等瑞宝章を受章
sen.e: 1973: Awarded the 3rd Class of the Order of the Sacred Treasure
1973: He was decorated with the 3rd Class of the Order of the Sacred Treasure.
sen.cmt: これについては勲章の「受章」ですので、decorated withとし、区別できるようにしました。
sen.e: 1973: He was decorated with the 3rd Class of the Order of the Sacred Treasure.

sen.j: 1981年：日本芸術院会員となる
sen.e: 1981: Becomes member of the Japan Art Academy
1981: He becomes a member of the Japan Art Academy.
sen.cmt: 文章の体裁を取るように修正しました。不定冠詞も加えてあります。
sen.e: 1981: He becomes a member of the Japan Art Academy.

sen.j: 1984年：文化勲章
sen.e: 1984: Awarded the Order of Culture
1984: He was decorated with the Order of Culture.
sen.cmt: これについては勲章の「受章」ですので、bestowedとし、区別できるようにしました。
sen.e: 1984: He was decorated with the Order of Culture.

sen.j: 1994年：松伯美術館が開館
sen.e: 1994: Shohaku Art Museum established
1994: Shohaku Art Museum was established and opened.
sen.cmt: 開館は原文に即し「open」を加えました。
sen.e: 1994: Shohaku Art Museum was established and opened.

sen.j: 2001年：心不全のため死去。
sen.e: 2001: Dies of heart failure
2001: He died of heart failure.
sen.cmt: 現在形を過去形に修正しました。
sen.e: 2001: He died of heart failure.
98 years old
His died at the age of 98.
sen.cmt: 文章の体裁を取るように修正しました。
sen.e: His died at the age of 98.

sen.j: ※創造美術はその後、新制作協会日本画部を経て創画会となる
sen.e: *Sozo Bijutsu became the Nihonga Division of Shinseisaku Association, and later, Sogakai.
*Sozo Bijyutsu later became the Nihonga Division of Shinseisaku Association, and reorganized as Sogakai.
*Sozo Bijyutsu later became the Nihonga Division of Shinseisaku Association, and reorganized as Sogakai.

sen.j: エピソード
sen.e: Anecdotes
Anecdotes
Anecdotes

sen.j: 鳥に関するもの
sen.e: Birds
His particular interest in Birds
sen.cmt: 原文の意味から意訳しすぎて意味が欠落しているように思います。追加しました。
sen.e: His particular interest in Birds

sen.j: 鳥の写生には強いこだわりを持っており、「鳥の生活を理解しなければ、鳥は描けない」と言い、鳥の観察の為にインドやオーストラリア、東南アジア等を旅行した。
sen.e: Uemura was extremely concerned with sketches of birds, saying that "birds cannot be drawn without the understanding of the way they live," and travelled India, Australia, Southeast Asia in order to study birds.

Shoko was very particular about the sketch of birds, saying that "birds cannot be drawn without the understanding of the way they live," thus he traveled India, Australia, Southeast Asia for observing birds.
sen.cmt: 名字の上村を使うのであれば全文字大文字のルールであるはずです。原文にはありませんので、先述されている「Shokoh」を用いました。
sen.e: Shoko was very particular about the sketch of birds, saying that "birds cannot be drawn without the understanding of the way they live," thus he traveled India, Australia, Southeast Asia for observing birds.

sen.j: とりかかると厄介なモチーフとして、ウズラを挙げている。
sen.e: He mentioned quails as especially difficult to take on.
He mentioned quail as an especially difficult motif to actually sketch and depict its details.
sen.cmt: 訳文は名詞節や形容詞節の区別なしに前置詞に繋がっています。修正しました。Take onは別の意味を持つフレーズですので他のものと入れ替えました。多少の意訳を行っています。
sen.e: He mentioned quail as an especially difficult motif to actually sketch and depict its details.

sen.j: 円山派の流れに立つが、円山派の描いた鳥に対しては、「十分、生きた鳥になりきっていない」と不満を言っていた。
sen.e: Although he also participated in the Maruyama school, he stated his dissatisfaction regarding birds drawn by Maruyama school artists, that "they were not enough like live birds."
Although he also participated in the Maruyama school, he mentioned his disapproval regarding the birds drawn by Maruyama school artists that those were not truly depicted as live birds yet.
sen.cmt: 意味の通りやすい英文になるよう修正しました。特定の絵画の対象ということで定冠詞を加えています。クォーテーションマークでかこった口語体を避け、文章の形になるよう修正しました。
sen.e: Although he also participated in the Maruyama school, he mentioned his disapproval regarding the birds drawn by Maruyama school artists that those were not truly depicted as live birds yet.

sen.j: 母・松園に対して
sen.e: His mother, Shoen
His relationship with his mother, Shoen
sen.cmt: 原文の意味から意訳しすぎて意味が欠落しているように思います。追加しました。
sen.e: His relationship with his mother, Shoen

sen.j: 幼い頃の松篁には、松園は『二階の画室にこもって絵を描いている』姿程度しか記憶になかった為、松園のことを「二階のお母さん」と呼んでいた。
sen.e: Because the young Shoko only remembered Shoen "shut up in the studio on the second floor drawing pictures," he called Shoen 'Mother on the second floor.'
Because young Shoko only remembered Shoen painting pictures by "shutting up herself in the studio on the second floor," he called Shoen as the 'Mother on the second floor.'
sen.cmt: 語順は重要度順になるよう修正しました。
sen.e: Because young Shoko only remembered Shoen painting pictures by "shutting up herself in the studio on the second floor," he called Shoen as the 'Mother on the second floor.'

sen.j: 松園が描いた作品で好きなものとして、『春苑』、『天保歌妓』の二つを挙げている。
sen.e: Out of the works of Shoen, he mentioned "Shunen" (Spring Garden) and "Tenpokagi" (Tenpo Era Songstress) as his favorites.
sen.cmt: Pronunciation of 春苑 and 天保歌妓 unclear.
sen.e: Out of the works of Shoen, he mentioned "Shunen" (Spring Garden) and "Tenpokagi" (Tenpo Era Songstress) as his favorites.
Out of the works of Shoen, he mentioned "Shunen" (Spring Garden) and "Tenpokagi" (Tenpo Era Songstress) as his favorites.

sen.j: 美人画を描かなかった（『万葉の春』の様に例外もある。）松篁だが、松園の影響を受けていることを認めている。
sen.e: Although Shoko did not draw bijinga (there are exceptions such as "Manyo no Haru" [Spring of Ten Thousand Leaves]), he admits to being influenced by Shoen.
Although Shoko did not draw bijinga (there are exceptions such as "Manyo no Haru" [A Spring of the eternal world]), he admitted receiving influence from Shoen.
sen.cmt: 万葉の春の万葉は常世の意味だと思います。説明を修正しました。原文が現在形と同型になっているためかと思われますが、過去形である文章です。修正しました。
sen.e: Although Shoko did not draw bijinga (there are exceptions such as "Manyo no Haru" [A Spring of the eternal world]), he admitted receiving influence from Shoen.

sen.j: 梅原猛の考察
sen.e: Takeshi UMEHARA's Critique
Takeshi UMEHARA's Critique
Takeshi UMEHARA's Critique

sen.j: 哲学者の梅原猛は、『アート・トップ』1978年12月号に掲載された小論で、「上村松篁の花鳥画は、鳥の世界に移された一種の美人画である。」と言う様な主旨を述べている。
sen.e: In an essay published in the December 1978 edition of periodical "Art Top", philosopher Takeshi UMEHARA mentioned the notion that 'Shoko UEMURA's paintings of flowers and birds are a type of bijinga transferred to the world of birds.'

In an essay published in the December 1978 edition of a periodical called "Art Top," a philosopher Takeshi UMEHARA described the flowers-and-birds painting of Shoko UEMURA is a type of bijinga descended into the world of birds.'
sen.cmt: 不定冠詞、定冠詞の問題を修正しました。複数、単数の問題を修正しました。
sen.e: In an essay published in the December 1978 edition of a periodical called "Art Top," a philosopher Takeshi UMEHARA described the flowers-and-birds painting of Shoko UEMURA is a type of bijinga descended into the world of birds.'

sen.j: また、「その根底には、幼少からの『人間嫌い』がある。」とも述べている。
sen.e: He also mentions that 'at the root of it is a "hate of people" from childhood.'
He also mentioned, 'there is a "misanthropy" for the root of his persistence on flowers-and birds painting, which was carried over from his childhood.'
sen.cmt: 原文が括弧による口語調となっていますので、その形式に合うようthatの省略等修正を行ないました。また、哲学者の論ですので、人間嫌いはよく用いられる単語、「misanthropy」を用いました。直訳を避け内容の分かる文章に修正しました。
sen.e: He also mentioned, 'there is a "misanthropy" for the root of his persistence on flowers-and birds painting, which was carried over from his childhood.'

sen.j: 主な作品
sen.e: Major Works
Major Works
Major Works

sen.j: 『星五位』（1958年、東京国立近代美術館蔵）
sen.e: "Hoshigoi" (Young Black-Crowned Black Heron) (1958, The National Museum of Modern Art, Tokyo)
"Hoshigoi" (Five Young Black-Crowned Herons as Stars) (1958, The National Museum of Modern Art, Tokyo)
sen.cmt: 「星五位」の意味が欠けていましたので追加しました。
sen.e: "Hoshigoi" (Five Young Black-Crowned Herons as Stars) (1958, The National Museum of Modern Art, Tokyo)

sen.j: 『万葉の春』（1970年、松伯美術館蔵）
sen.e: "Manyo no Haru" (1970, Shohaku Art Museum)
"Manyo no Haru" (A Spring of the eternal world) (1970, Shohaku Art Museum)
sen.cmt: 万葉の春の英訳を括弧に収めました。
sen.e: "Manyo no Haru" (A Spring of the eternal world) (1970, Shohaku Art Museum)

sen.j: 『樹下幽禽』（1966年、日本芸術院蔵）
sen.e: "Juka Yukin" (Phantom Bird Under Tree) (1966, The Japan Art Academy)
"Juka Yukin" (Phantom Bird Under Tree) (1966, The Japan Art Academy)
"Juka Yukin" (Phantom Bird Under Tree) (1966, The Japan Art Academy)

sen.j: 『閑鷺』（1977年、山種美術館蔵）
sen.e: "Lazy Herons" (1977, Yamatane Museum)
"Kansagi" (Quiet Herons) (1977, Yamatane Museum)
sen.cmt: 閑鷺は読みを記述し、英訳は括弧に収めました。「lazy」は「quiet」と変更しました。
sen.e: "Kansagi" (Quiet Herons) (1977, Yamatane Museum)
